message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which I believe is worth more than $120 to you. Considering its exceptional quality and value, I am proposing to sell it to you for $150. This offer includes a special bonus package that will enhance your experience with the product. I hope you find this proposal attractive and look forward to your response.
Thanks for the offer, Alice. While I appreciate the bonus package, $150 is a bit higher than my budget. I'm willing to pay $120 for the product. Let me know what you think.

Thank you for your prompt response, Bob. I understand your budget constraints, and I'm glad to work within them to reach an agreement. In light of that, I would like to offer you the product for $140. This price includes all the features you're interested in, along with a limited-time discount. I hope this revised offer suits your needs better and look forward to your positive response.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down on the price, but $140 is still a little too high for me.  I'm really set on $120. If you can meet me there, I'll take the product off your hands.  If not, I'll have to go with John's offer.

I understand your position, Bob, and I'm committed to finding a solution that works for both of us. After careful consideration, I'm willing to offer the product to you for $135. This price reflects the value I place on maintaining a positive relationship with you while ensuring a reasonable profit margin for myself. I hope this revised offer meets your expectations and allows us to proceed with the transaction.
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $135 is still a bit out of my price range. I'm really sticking to $120.  If you can't go that low, I'll have to go with John's offer.
